nodes.bodyText:
19/name has 18 (single character, special type) and 22/int2vector has PG_TYPE_INT2 in the real PostgreSQL.
For 18 special fake row 18/char may be needed.
I also don't see 0/null in the real PostgreSQL, perhaps it should be removed.
typtype=b for all these special types, but currently H2 returns b only for regproc.
In fact oid for regproc in PostgreSQL is 24 but not 2205. May be special reason in H2's history.

It was introduced in 18cfcf6, see also https://code.google.com/archive/p/h2database/issues/481
Actually It looks like copy-paste error from PosgreSQL query results, regclass is 2205, but regproc is 24. I'm not sure what should be here, maybe both of them.

Please, merge changes from the master branch and use PG_TYPE_VARCHAR_ARRAY / 1015 here.
You can add support for more types of array, but it requires some additional work.
